block.p: LEAD: Bruce Laingen, who spent 444 days as a hostage of Iranian revolutionaries in 1979-80, finds his first duty after retirement from the State Department curiously reminiscent of part of his diplomatic career. The former charge d'affaires in Teheran is spending much of his time at the department's career counseling center, which happens to be situated in Annex 20, the former Iranian Embassy on Massachusetts Avenue that was seized by the United States in retaliation for Iran's taking of the American Embassy.
